dict.string: on alfred_script(q) -- Feel free to change this, I found 0.75 seems to work 100% of the time set myDelay to 0.75 set productKey to q as string if productKey is "" then set productKey to (the clipboard) as string end if if productKey is "" then return end if tell application "Steam" activate tell application "System Events" tell process "Steam" click menu item "Activate a Product on Steam..." of menu "Games" of menu bar item "Games" of menu bar 1 delay myDelay key code 36 delay myDelay key code 36 delay myDelay repeat with x in characters 1 thru end of productKey if (x ≥ "a" and x ≤ "z") or (x ≥ "0" and x ≤ "9") then keystroke x end if end repeat delay 0.25 key code 36 delay myDelay repeat if window "Steam - Working" exists then delay 0.25 else exit repeat end if end repeat key code 36 delay myDelay key code 53 end tell end tell end tell tell application "System Events" to keystroke tab using command down end alfred_script
Activate products on Steam by including the key or having it on the clipboard
